heading: Artificial Life Institute
body: We investigate how lifelike behavior emerges from interacting components, from synthetic chemistries to embodied collectives.\n\nOur institute connects computation, biology, robotics, and philosophy to build experiments that reveal the conditions for adaptation, persistence, and open-ended change.

heading: Research themes
body: We work across open-ended evolution, morphogenesis, distributed intelligence, and ecological resilience. Our projects combine modeling with hands-on experimentation and theory development.

heading: Working together
body: We host seminars, visiting scholars, and collaborative projects that translate artificial life research into shared tools and public-facing initiatives.

heading: About the Institute
body: The Artificial Life Institute at the University of Vienna advances research on lifelike dynamics and adaptive systems. We combine rigorous theory with experimental practice and open research culture.

heading: History & scope
body: We study the principles that make complex systems resilient, creative, and capable of generating novelty. Our work bridges laboratory experimentation, computational modeling, and philosophical analysis.

heading: People & culture
body: We are an interdisciplinary group of researchers, students, and collaborators committed to open science and shared infrastructure for artificial life research.

heading: Research Focus
body: Our research asks how lifelike behaviors arise, how they can be engineered, and how they inform our understanding of living systems.

heading: Core themes
body: We study open-ended evolution, artificial chemistries, morphogenesis, adaptive collectives, and synthetic ecologies. Each theme is pursued with theory, simulation, and experimental validation.

heading: Methods & infrastructure
body: We build experimental platforms for embodied agents, open-source simulation tools, and analytical frameworks for emergent phenomena.

heading: Projects & Platforms
body: Our initiatives translate artificial life research into long-horizon experiments, shared tools, and public-facing collaborations.

heading: Current portfolio
body: We maintain a portfolio of projects spanning synthetic ecologies, adaptive robotics, and experimental systems for collective behavior. Replace this placeholder with project summaries and partners.

heading: Working with us
body: We collaborate across disciplines and welcome proposals for joint research, hosting, and co-development of experimental systems.

heading: Contact
body: Reach out to discuss research collaborations, visiting scholar opportunities, and student projects. We respond to inquiries throughout the academic year.

heading: Visit & collaborate
